modName: ADEC Dawnguard Armor and Clothing Collection
summary: Dawnguard DLC armors and clothes made to fit [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5390]Acdale's EyeCandy Body (ADEC)[/URL]
descriptionHtml:
[CENTER][IMG]http://imgur.com/mOtF1.png[/IMG]
[B][COLOR=#ffc000][SIZE=5]ADEC Dawnguard DLC Armor And Clothing [/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]
Latest: 1.1 [/CENTER]
This is a collection of all the clothing and armors converted to fit the ADEC body version 1.19 or later. These armors are not compatible with other alternative bodies.



[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]Requirements:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

Of course , Dawnguard DLC
[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5390]Acdale's EyeCandy Body (ADEC)[/URL] v2.4 or later required.

[I][COLOR=#ffff00]NOTE:[/COLOR][/I] [I][COLOR=#ffff00]For people that have installed the Bethesda's Official HR texture pack from Steam, please refer to the Troubleshooting section i added at the bottom of this page.[/COLOR][/I]



[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]Installation:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

Use the Nexus Mod Manager to download and install the entire package.
[SIZE=3][B][I]OR[/I][/B][/SIZE]
Open the folder of the armor or clothing you wish to install then copy the meshes and textures folders to your data folder.



[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]The Collection:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#ffc000][SIZE=4]ADEC Dawnguard Collection Contents:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=2]Breast Physics Enabled Armors:[/SIZE][/COLOR]
Vampire Armor, Vampire Royal Armor , Dawnguard Armor * all 4 variants * , Moth Priest Robes.
[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=2]Non-Breast Physics Enabled Armors: [/SIZE][/COLOR]
Ancient Falmer Armor ( aka Ivory )
Heavy Falmer Armor


[COLOR=#ffc000][SIZE=4]ADEC Dawnguard Options:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=2]Breast Physics Enabled Armors:[/SIZE][/COLOR]
Vampire Royal Armor *shawl*
[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=2]Non-Breast Physics Enabled Armors: [/SIZE][/COLOR]
Ancient Falmer Armor *no skirt*
Heavy Falmer Armor *no skirt*



[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]My Other Armor Mods:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7782]
ADEC Armor N Clothing Compilation by AcDale[/URL]
[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24390]
ADEC Tera Armor Collection by AcDale[/URL]



[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]Versions:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[B][COLOR=#ffc000][SIZE=3]Version 1.0:[/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]
Initial Release

[B][COLOR=#ffc000][SIZE=3]Version 1.1:[/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]
Added Heavy Falmer Armor ( no skirt option is available in the optional download section )
Added Moth Priest Robes ( TBBP compatible )




[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]Credits:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

Bethesda for an awesome game
Killerkeo for permission to convert his skimpy armor and clothing. The panties on the Ancient Falmer armor are taken straight from his mod.



[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]License & Legal:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[B][COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]Do not upload this mod to steam workshop or any other site[/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]


[COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=4]Troubleshooting:[/SIZE][/COLOR]

[B][COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=2]Note:[/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]
Animations that utilize the breast bones are not included in this download. This mod can be used fine without installing Cherry's mod first but if you wish to see the breast move you will need her animations from her mod listed below.
Instructions:
Be sure to install Cherry Hotalings [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4888]CHSBHC - BBP - Nude and Jiggly Mod[/URL] first. It is required for physics to work. You only need the animation files.

Then install [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5390]ADEC Eyecandy Body[/URL] version 2.4 or later overwrite any files from cherrys mod.

Next install the armors you want to use from the single downloads section or install the main collection file.



[B][COLOR=#ff0000][SIZE=3]Note:[/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]

If you have installed Bethesda's Official HR texture pack from Steam, be sure to do the steps below or some of the custom armor textures included in this mod will not show

[I]Short solution:[/I]
[LIST=1]
[*]Disable in your launcher or remove from SteamSteamAppscommonskyrimData this two plugins files:
HighResTexturePack01.esp, HighResTexturePack02.esp
[*]Activate them in your DocumentsMy GamesSkyrimSkyrim.ini in the [Archive] by modifying these two lines :[/LIST][CODE][Archive]
sResourceArchiveList=Skyrim - Misc.bsa, Skyrim - Shaders.bsa, Skyrim - Textures.bsa, Skyrim - Interface.bsa, Skyrim - Animations.bsa, Skyrim - Meshes.bsa, Skyrim - Sounds.bsa, HighResTexturePack01.bsa, HighResTexturePack02.bsa
sResourceArchiveList2=Skyrim - Voices.bsa, Skyrim - VoicesExtra.bsa, HighResTexturePack01.bsa, HighResTexturePack02.bsa[/CODE]

This way, it deactivate the plugins files that override every custom textures, but activate the HR textures in your .ini files so that the textures of your mods get on the objects modified by your mods, while it keeps the HR textures for the rest of the game.

[I]Better solution:[/I]
[LIST=1]
[*]Delete the Bethesda HighResTexturePack01.esp and HighResTexturePack02.esp.
[*]Install [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=607]Skyrim HD[/URL].[/LIST]The Bethesda Texture Pack has been known to cause more than just the odd skin problem.
author: AcDale
